ygData.subject: Re: Zones zones Zones
ygData.msgSnippet: GOD GOD - WHY LESSER FAY? That was the zone I ve spent 95% of my UO life in, PLEASE don t give them any ideas about messin it up. The addition of brownie
ygData.messageBody:
GOD GOD - WHY LESSER FAY?

That was the zone I've spent 95% of my UO life in, PLEASE don't give them
any ideas about messin it up.

The addition of brownie outcasts and shadowed men were quite enough -
thanks anyway.

BTW - there is a ton of good stuff in that zone, folks just never take the
time to find out where it is.



At 07:32 PM 12/1/99 PST, you wrote:
>From: "jay schultze" <sartori69@...>
>
>Hehehe no they haven't met face to face. =)
>
>I hate what they've done to Kithicor. I personally don't mind the mobs as a
>50th, but I made the mistake of going afk at RV zone with my druid and
>someone trained 4 or 5 uber-skellies there. Luckily I got back in time to
>zone. It's the location. They should've put these mobs somewhere else like
>in Lesser Faydark. I feel sorry for halfling newbies that don't have friends
>to gate them out of there when they have Runnyeye/Beholder on one side and
>Kith on the other.
>
>Hopefully Paineel will be something cool and different and worthwhile for
>higher levels. I think it MIGHT be opened by the end of the year. The orc
>highway you are talking about - I always thought that would be a good place
>for another zone myself. Maybe it's supposed to go to the Rujarkian Hills
>like it shows on the atlas? I think it should lead to a badlands
>(non-desert) type of place. Would be nice. There are a ton of places on the
>Norrathian Atlas they can add that have yet to be implemented (and most
>probly never will). The Dead Hills near Feerrot sound interesting. =)
>
>Sartori D'Elsiraad <The Companions>
>Bard of Quellious of the 50th Chorus
>Veeshan
>
>
>>From: "RaceFace" <bean@...>
>>Reply-To: eqbards@onelist.com
>>To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
>>Subject: Re: [eqbards] Twinking Causes a Crisis of Faith
>>Date: Wed, 1 Dec 1999 21:08:47 -0600
>>Possibly, but they've never met each other face to face, have they? ;)
>>
>>I hope it turns out very well for you folks. :)
>>
>>I'm glad I won't get level 50 for another year or so. :) Maybe by then
>>there will be a lot more things to do, and places to see.
>>
>>I happen to like trying to get through Kithicor now. I'm level 19, but I'd
>>still die in a heartbeat if one of the undead happened to get a hold of me.
>>I like having a zone I actually worry about getting through safely. It's
>>become one of those zones parents tell their little children about to scare
>>them. :)
>>
>>I didn't say there IS things for level 50's to do, I said there SHOULD be.
>>:) I know there's hardly anything to do. I'm on Tunare, and the number of
>>people in the high 40's up to 50 is getting to be rather insane.
>>
>>Something does need to be done, and done quickly. Zones zones zones. That
>>is the ONLY way to solve the overcrowding problem. Maybe they should think
>>about hiring 5 more people and getting them to work on zones exclusively.
>>There's plenty of areas where a zone would fit nicely in the world.
>>
>>Have a subterranean zone with an entrance in the Qeynos sewers. (Some
>>workers were repairing a wall, when <crack> the floor opened up, and they
>>fell into a deep chasm.) Populate it with some sort of cavern dwelling
>>beasties. Possibly have a zone inside this one. Have the initial one for
>>mid-levels (15-25 or so maybe), and have the deepest section of it enter a
>>new zone, for 30+.
>>
>>I would say something on Odus, but Paineel is supposed to open one of the
>>decades, isn't it? That's going to be another high level zone, if I
>>remember correctly.
>>
>>There's one spot in the Oasis that looks like it's a valley, and should
>>lead
>>somewhere, but it doesn't. Is that going to be a new zone someday? If
>>not,
>>they could put one there. Maybe the "home of the sand giants" or some
>>such.
>>
>>Damn, I should work for Verant. I'll whip up these zones myself, dangit!
>>
>>-Gaelaian, hopeful bard of the 19th song, Tunare.
>
>>Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to lol@...
with the subject submissions.
>
